subject: Law
title: Non-Disclosure Agreements
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Non-Disclosure Agreements.

hook.text: Before seeing the startup's business plan, the investor signs an NDA. Now sharing that info could mean a lawsuit.

buildup.text: A non-disclosure agreement (NDA) is a contract that binds someone to keep shared information confidential.

discovery.text: NDAs define what's confidential, how long the obligation lasts, and what happens if someone breaches.

twist.text: NDAs are only as strong as your willingness to enforce them. A breach with no lawsuit sets a dangerous precedent.

climax.text: Some NDAs are mutualâ€”both sides share secrets. Others are one-way, protecting only one party's information.

punchline.text: An NDA turns a handshake promise into a legal obligation.
